results.title: My fair lady (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The dazzling film version of Lerner and Loewe’s acclaimed musical. Audrey Hepburn stars as the cockney flowergirl Eliza Doolittle who is trained by Professor Higgins (Rex Harrison) to pass as a duchess. Featuring sumptuous cinematography and costumes by Cecil Beaton, this is one of the most popular musicals ever filmed. Winner of eight Academy Awards including Best Picture. The original musical is based on George Bernard Shaw’s “Pygmalion”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Cukor, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: My Brilliant Career
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Margaret Fink and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the novel, “My Brilliant Career” by Miles Franklin, this is the story of Sybella Melvyn, a sensitive, passionate young woman who leaves the countryside in search of an artistic future. She develops a relationship with landowner Harry Beecham, but is faced with making a decision between less-than-perfect love and independence. Starring Judy Davis and Sam Neill.

results.title: My best friend's wedding (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: P.J. Hogan, Ronald Bass, Jerry Zucker and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Julia Roberts stars in this hilarious tale of lovelorn food critic Julianne, who discovers she wants to spend the rest of her life with her best friend the day he pops the question to someone else. She has four days to break up the wedding and help her best friend discover that she’s the one. With an outstanding supporting cast including Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett, this film takes the cake as the romantic comedy of the year.

results.title: Muppet Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Jim Henson Productions, Martin G. Baker and Brian Henson
results.brief_description: The Muppets cast off for the high-seas adventure in this swashbuckling send-up of Robert Louis Stevenson’s immortal tale. Cast features Tim Curry as Long John Silver and the voices of Billy Connolly, Jennifer Saunders, Kevin Bishop, Frank Oz.

results.title: Mrs. Soffel
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Scott Rudin, Edgar J. Scherick and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A woman who distributes Bibles to prison inmates has an affair with one of them and later helps him to escape. Set in Pittsburgh at the turn of the century, starring Diane Keaton and Mel Gibson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gillian Armstrong, Scott Rudin, Edgar J. Scherick and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: Mouchette
results.creator_credit: Robert Bresson, Anatole Dauman, Parc Film and Argos Films
results.brief_description: Based on the Georges Bernanos novel “Nouvelle histiore de Mouchette”, Robert Bresson’s unflinching tale of poverty and cruelty is an agonising and unsentimental film experience. Mouchette (Nadine Nortier) is a 14 year old peasant school girl. Her mother is dying and her father is a brutal alcoholic, leaving her to fend for herself and her baby brother amidst a harsh and indifferent community. When local poacher Arsene (Jean-Claude Guilbert) turns to Mouchette for an alibi over a possible murder, the young girl desperately responds to his neediness, unaware that she is being used yet again. Bresson strips scenes, performances and emotions down to their bare necessities, creating a unique style which at first might seem alienating but ultimately depicts the human experience with mystery, grace and poignancy. In French with English subtitles. Cast also includes Maria Cardinal, Paul Herbert, Jean Vimenet (Awards: Best film 1967 Venice Film festival)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Bresson, Anatole Dauman, Parc Film and Argos Films

results.title: Mother night
results.creator_credit: Keith Gordon, Robert B Weide and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Based on a novel by Kurt Vonnegut “Mother Night” follows the story of an American playwright (Nick Nolte) living in Germany during WWII. He is approached by a US agent to become a spy. By broadcasting coded Nazi propaganda on the radio he is able to pass on allied information. During this time he seems to be a convincing Nazi. With only a few knowing his true beliefs he finds himself helpless in Israel on trial for war crimes. A moody story of assumed identity and a man alone in a strange world. Cast includes Alan Arkin, Kristen Dunst, John Goodman and an appearance of Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

results.title: Moonstruck
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Patrick Palmer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A delightful romantic comedy which warms the heart. Cher plays Loretta Castorini, widowed at a young age due to “bad luck”. Engaged to timid Johnny Cammareri (Danny Aiello), Loretta attempts to mend the estrangement between Johnny and his brother Ronny. Instead, she falls in love with Ronny (Nicholas Cage). “Moonstruck” takes us into the hearts and minds of a loving Brooklyn-Italian family, sharing their dramas, tragedies and joys. “La bella Luna”, the moon, forms a romantic backdrop for the turbulent affairs of the heart and creates an atmosphere where anything can happen, and does! Co-starring Vincent Gardenia and Olympia Dukakis.
